intro: Neosasamorpha nakashimana, commonly known as the Nakashima's neosasamorpha, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique, clustered inflorescences and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are usually alternate and lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
